title: ENERtec Asia 2024: Driving Sustainable Urban and Industrial Energy Transition in Southeast Asia - PR Newswire
summary: The ASEAN M&E trade show is rebranding to ENERtec Asia to focus on sustainable energy solutions. The event will showcase renewable energy, energy efficiency, and electric vehicle technologies. ENERtec Asia aims to accelerate the energy transition in Southeast Asia by bringing together key stakeholders and promoting innovation.

title: 2024 oil and gas industry outlook - Deloitte
summary: The refining industry needs to change to meet new market demands. Refiners can take advantage of opportunities in biofuels, hydrogen and ammonia, electric vehicles, chemicals, and carbon capture, usage, and storage (CCUS) to stay in business. Leading refiners that change their strategies to meet changing demand and make sure their supply chain is secure will be the most successful in the energy transition.

title: We are committed to championing environmentally sustainable practices: Hitachi Energy India - Your Gateway to ... - T&D India
summary: Hitachi Energy India is committed to championing environmentally sustainable practices and is making significant technological advancements that are setting new benchmarks for the transformer industry. The company has inaugurated a transformer components factory in Gujarat to produce RIP bushings, which are a more environmentally friendly alternative to traditional OIP bushings. Hitachi Energy is also supplying 400kV transformers for renewable energy evacuation in Gujarat, demonstrating its commitment to advancing sustainable energy infrastructure.

summary: Brunei's economy is recovering, with growth expected to come in at 0.2 percent in 2023 and 2.4 percent in 2024. title: National vision for engineering biology - GOV.UK
summary: There is a range of sustainability goals that this article references including reducing negative environmental externalities, decarbonisation, reducing or replacing harmful substances with less harmful ones, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, nature and wildlife conservation, increasing energy efficiency, and promoting the protection of biological systems. 'Green' innovations are defined in general terms as any innovation that reduces negative environmental externalities of human activity, either by individuals or by organizations.  This article discusses issues, challenges, and opportunities in engineering biology, which is the application of rigorous engineering principles to the design of biological systems, and which is driven largely by the convergence of several technology trends. The article discusses how engineering biology may solve major global issues such as sustainability and global health challenges, as well as help secure the UK's safety, resilience and supply chains.

title: Thaioil and Chulalongkorn University Forge Collaborative Research Agreements - Bangkok Post
summary: Thaioil, a Thai oil and gas company, has signed MOUs with Chulalongkorn University's Petroleum and Petrochemical College and Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences for R&D cooperation. The collaboration aims to enhance research and development for new business opportunities, cutting-edge technology, and efficient production processes. Thaioil also plans to jointly develop disinfectant products with the Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences.
